item.title: Skating in Manila
item.description: A couple of weeks ago, a crew of dudes traveled across the Pacific to the Philippines to skate, shoot some photos, and get a few clips. Brandon Westgate, Chima Ferguson, Chris Pfanner, and David Gravette were the talent, along with a couple of filmers, a photographer and a team manger or two to keep tabs on things. The boys had a great trip, they put on a few demos, found some new spots, and made a bunch of new friends. Music by Riverboat Gamblers.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Beaverfish Surf Series - Tofino, Canada
item.description: Canada Eh? That's right were back in Canada for fourth annual Beaverfish Surf Series at North Chesterman's, Tofino. This is one of the most unique events on the VQS Tour and holding the contest in November you never know what to expect as far as weather goes. Music by: Kandi Coded.
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: Canada, Eh? That's right were back in Canada for the Beaverfish Surf Series in Tofino. This is one of the most unique events on the VQS Tour and holding the contest in November you never know what to expect as far as weather goes. Music by: Kandi Coded.

item.title: Louie Lopez Kills It!
item.description: On this particular night, we were ending off a day of skating with a Tempe skatepark sesh. Everyone was having a good time shredding but Louie Lopez was on fire this particular night, especially when it came to the step-up. Jake Duncombe and Darrell Stanton started placing bets to spice things up and little Lou was up for the task who gave them a run for their money.
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: Everyone was having a good time shredding but Louie Lopez was on fire this particular night, especially when it came to the step-up. Jake Duncombe and Darrell Stanton started placing bets to spice things up and little Lou gave them a run for their money.

item.title: Simple Pleasures in Santa Cruz!
item.description: Santa Cruz rules! Every year we take a trip up there to surf, catch up with friends, check out the Coldwater Classic and just have a good time. For some reason, this was one of our best trips ever to the place. Maybe it was the gorgeous weather. Or the fun waves. Or the outstanding crew that we had. Music by: The Epsilons.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Pufferfish Surf Series - Pinetrees, Kauai
item.description: We rolled up to Pine Trees on Friday to check the waves before the event, but found nothing but flatness. With no swell in the forecast we were scrambling, trying to find a new contest site anywhere with a hint of waves. After all these attempts failed we were left thinking we’d have to postpone or cancel the event. However, mother nature had other plans and sent us some insane chest to head high waves with rippable conditions all day. Music by: Kandi Coded.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Jellyfish Surf Series - Long Beach, New York
item.description: Well after a blustery day in New Jersey the day before, we were hoping to find some clean overhead surf in New York. Despite the buoy readings we rolled up to find knee high slop. Mother Nature however, had other plans for the VQS, and slowly but surely, the swell increased until perfect head high lefts were firing down the beach. With increasing swell, an awesome crowd, and a nuts day we got under way! Here's the rundown of how the day went down! Music by: Aloke.

item.itunes:subtitle: Well after a blustery day in New Jersey the day before, we were hoping to find some clean overhead surf in New York. The swell increased until perfect head high lefts were firing down the beach. Here's the rundown of how the day went! Music by: Aloke.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Jellyfish Surf Series - Casino Pier, New Jersey
item.description: On Saturday October 18th, the Jellyfish landed at Casino Pier, New Jersey. After having to cancel the week before due to flatness, Mother Nature threw us some solid wind swell mixed up by groundswell from a passing hurricane. The mix-up of swell created some fun peaky surf all weekend long. Despite the cold weather, the waves had competitors ready to sign up at the crack of dawn. Here's how it all went down. Music by Single Frame.

item.title: 2008 Damn Am at Volcom!
item.description: The 2008 Damn Am wrapped up this past weekend here at the Volcom Facility in Costa Mesa California. David Loy came out swinging on his final run and took 1st place to become a repeat winner here in front of his home crowd. Music by: ASG.
item.itunes:author: Volcom

item.title: Volcom Stone's Goldfish Surf Series - Morro Bay, Ca
item.description: The first Goldfish event of the year kicked off in Central Cal. Despite the challenging conditions and cold water, the kids were as stoked as ever, screaming for more mayhem even after the final buzzer. The fierce competitors let no obstacle stand in their path, from the feeding frenzy circling the lineup, to the hurricane force winds; they battled it out to the end, each on the hunt for the key positioning needed to qualify for the VQS World Champs. Music by: Nihilist.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Bushfish Surf Series - Corpus Christi, Texas
item.description: With the remnants of Hurricane Ike strewn everywhere and the vibe of destruction hanging thick in the air, it was a toss-up as to whether or not we should run this years Bushfish event or postpone it. Instead of following what others would do and cancel the contest, we decided to really dig our heels in and throw one of the best events we’ve ever run with more free stuff than ever before. Music by Valient Thorr.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Greatwhite Surf Series - Pleasure Point, CA
item.description: Once again the Greatwhite Surf Series came alive for the season opener at Pleasure Point in Santa Cruz. Just like last years first event, the Greatwhite was greeted with some fun rippable 4-5 surf. With overheads sets pouring in at first light, the cliff was quickly packed with competitors scrambling to be the first to get their entry forms in. Here's how the day unfolded. Music by: http://www.myspace.com/nihilistmetalcom.

item.title: All The Days Roll Into One - Teasisode #1
item.description: Over the course of the month of May, the Volcom skate team posted up in an apartment in Brooklyn, NY with the sole purpose of skating epic New York spots. We decided to team up with the boys over at Fuel TV to bring you a 30-minute show on our trip. The show is called, "All The Days Roll Into One" and will premiere on Fuel TV on October 20th at 8 pm - this is the first of three "teasisodes" that we will be releasing every other week until the premiere of the show. Music by Year Long Disaster.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Starfish Surf Series - Huntington Beach, Ca
item.description: The second stop of the Starfish Surf Series event went off at HB pier with some incredible waves. Looking at the forecast we were pretty worried about the lack of swell, but first light Saturday morning we were greeted with some 4-6 ft waves. The turnout was one of the biggest we’ve ever seen with sign ups reaching maximum capacity by 6:50 AM! Music by: Amored Assassin.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Blowfish Surf Series - D Street, Encinitas
item.description: After a brief hiatus, the Blowfish Surf Series retuned to D street in Encinitas to kick off the season opener. As soon as we pulled up to the beach at 6am, we knew we had made the right call, as empty 3-5 ft peaky A frames came rolling through. With competitors already showing up, we had to set up quick for a full day of debauchery and shredding. Music by Valient Thorr.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Surf team at the 2008 NSSA Nationals
item.description: The time we all spent down at Lowers last week was was nothing less than terrific. One of the best things about the event is getting to see and catch up with all of the people that we see only once a year for the contest. Check out the video of everybody shredding and a big congrats out to Andrew Doheny, who won Open Juniors for the second year in a row, and all of the Volcom youth who gave it their all at lowers. Video by Dave Post - Music by Valient Thorr.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Cody McEntire gets a dozen tricks in Arizona
item.description: This little session occurred during our recent trip to Phoenix, AZ. I was doing some filming at Pecos Park and I could see Cody attacking the cement quarter pipe in the middle of the park. I skated up and asked him to film some stuff for a 10-tricks clip on the website. Well, he got to ten and the session was still heated so I kept recording. It looks like he gave you guys a few extra. Filmed & edited by Jake Smith.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: This little session occurred during our recent trip to Phoenix, AZ. Filmed & edited by Jake Smith.

item.title: Apples, Trapasso, Duncombe & Gonzalez movie from Costa Rica
item.description: Last month Mark Appleyard, Nick Trapasso, Jake Duncombe and David Gonzalez took a trip to Costa Rica to hang with the locals and skate some spots. While in town, they cruised to our first ever Wild in the Parks in Central America and threw together a demo for the crowd. They were mostly in San Jose where they skated some indoor parks while trying to stay out of the rain. Music by Valient Thorr.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Behind The Scenes of the Valient Thorr FUEL TV 'Check 1,2' shoot
item.description:
MarkG had is camera in tow all day as Valient Thorr and the FUEL TV crew invaded the Volcom Skate Park to shoot a 30 minute special that will include live performances of new songs from their upcoming album, IMMORTALIZER (out July 17th), interviews, skate sessions, and painting.

Valient Thorr FUEL TV "Check 1, 2" special:
5/29/2008 – 2:00amet/11:00pmpt, 5:30amet/2:30ampt
5/31/2008 – 1:00amet/10:00pm pt
6/10/2008 – 5:00pmet/2:00pmpt

Check your local listings or www.fuel.tv for channel information.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom Entertainment

item.title: 2008 VQS Totally Crustaceous Muscle Beach Champs!
item.description: After 76 events in 16 countries around the world, the vast field of competitors was narrowed down to 256 for the 2008 VQS World Championships Muscle Beach Party. Each of them qualified in their respective regions and made their way to Newport Beach for this muscular event of steroidal proportions. Once all of the gym membership forms were filled out, the fitness center was opened and the intense iron pumping sessions began. Right from the start the competition was strenuous and you could really feel the burn!
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom

item.title: 2008 Phoenix Am Video recap!
item.description: The annual Phoenix Am just went down this past weekend at the Rio Vista Skatepark in Peoria. We loaded the van a few days early and headed out to the desert to skate the local parks and streets. Volcom riders Louie Lopez, Collin Provost and Cody Mcentire shred up AZ. Video and Edit by Jake Smith. Music by ((sounder)).

item.title: ((sounder)) Directors Collaboration Project #1
item.description: This is the first installation of the ((sounder)) Director’s Collaboration Project a series of 5 videos premiering every month throughout the spring and summer of 2008. Featured artist/directors are Michael Sieben, Mel Kadel, Todd Bratrud, Travis Millard and Dave Bryant. All of the artists worked with Mike Aho in a creative collaboration to develop images that either capture or decompose the music through the use of drawings, film, animation and video. Check out ((sounder)) at Myspace.com/thesounder

item.title: Bruce Irons and Dean Morrison video from 2008 Snapper WCT
item.description: We were searching through some tapes and just found the footage from last week when Bruce Irons and Dean Morrison were on the Gold Coast for the first WCT of the year (The Quik Pro). Volcom surf corpo, Doug Herty filmed the boys while he was perched high above Snapper on the 13th floor of the Rainbow Bay Apartments, and on top of the headland at D'bah. The action is hot and the footage is shaky - but that's what you get with no tripod and a cold VB in your hand.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: 2008 Tampa pro weekend wrap-up!
item.description: Another Tampa Pro has come and gone and this one was definitely a memorable experience. Volcom Brazil rider Pedro Barros showed the crowd what it looks like for a 12 year old kid to rip apart a vert ramp, getting him in 2nd place. In the street contest, Volcom had a solid attendance with Nick Dompierre, Dennis Busenitz, and Ryan Sheckler all making it to the semi-finals, and Dennis and Ryan making it to the final top 10. Music by Birds of Avalon.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Cooterfish Surf Series - Wrightsville Beach, NC
item.description: Thank you Mother Nature! She held us back for two attempts and finally gave us some contestable surf this past weekend in the wonderful town of Wrightsville Beach, North Carolina. We awoke to overcast conditions, but as the morning progressed the sun broke through the clouds and lit up the 2-3 ft clean peaks. The kids signed up early and we got under way. Here is a rundown of the day’s events. Music by Birds of Avalon.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Goldfish Surf Series - Cayucos Pier, Ca
item.description: First light on Feb. 9th brought offshore winds, sunny skies and clean groomed 6-8ft surf at Morro Rock. We quickly assembling the VQS tent city, signed all the frothing kids up, called the first heat to check in, and to our surprise a huge 15ft clean up set came through and never seamed to let up. The out of control surf at Morro Bay left us no choice, but to move the contest up to Cayucos Pier. Music by Nihilist.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Skatepark Montage with Rowley, Apples, Duncombe and more!
item.description: We have just finished our third Skatepark Montage installment at our private facility. This video was filmed over a span of a few weeks showing the heavy shredding the park receives on a daily basis. Featured Volcom riders in the montage include little Louie Lopez, Jake Duncombe, David Gravette, Mark Appleyard, Filipe Ortiz, Taylor Smith and ending it off with Geoff Rowley. Music by Birds of Avalon.

item.title: Volcom Europe skate session in Alicante, Spain!
item.description: Our fearless team manager drove it all the way down from the Volcom skate team house in Bilbao, to Santa Pola, Alicante while testing the airflow and windspeed factors of our newest vehicle. Passengers on this wild test flight were Willow, Peter Molec, Charles Collet, Chris Pfanner and our host and guide at the testing area, Roberto Aleman, aka “the bullfighter”. Music by Year Long Disaster.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Seacow Surf Series - Navarre Pier, Florida
item.description: The day was going great, the kids were having fun and then all hell broke loose. The cold front that we thought was going to hold off giving us time to run the event slammed us with gale force winds, Lightning, and the always-fun sideways rain. We got lucky and had a quick break in the clouds so we double beached it and finished the event. Music by Valient Thorr.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Seacow Surf Series - Sebastian Inlet, Florida
item.description: Once again the Seacow Surf Series at Sebastian Inlet delivered Surf, Sun, and a huge turnout. With over 180 Volcompeditors signed up and ready to go we got under way. The day started off with super fun 2nd peak waves rolling in and ended with a bit of red tide but everyone stuck it out filling their eyes with Japanese eye drops between every heat. We finished right at dark, slapped high fives and headed home. Here’s a little ditty about the day. Music by Nihilist.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Beaverfish Surf Series - Tofino, BC
item.description: Rain, rain and more rain and than some more rain. I've never seen so much rain, but it won't stop anyone or thing in Canada. And it sure didn't put a stop to the third annual Beaverfish Surf Series at North Chesterman's. This year we were greeted the morning of the event with somewhat of decent weather for Tofino, which included some holes in the clouds with a bit of sunshine in the morning and waves that seamed to be spot on with the past two years of stormy and wild surf in the head high plus range. Music by Freedom Hawk.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Jellyfish Surf Series - Seaside Heights, New Jersey
item.description: Once again the waves were going off for the Jellyfish Surf Series in Seaside Heights. All I can really say is thanks again to Tropical Storm Noel. The Casino Pier was once again the event sight and will continue to be if we keep getting such good waves. This was the second event of the weekend with NY being the day before so we had a solid group of competitors in line to sign up and gain points towards the VQS Champs. With good waves and a full contest we got under way around 8:30. Here is how the days events unfolded. Music by Freedom Hawk.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Jellyfish Surf Series - Long Beach, New York
item.description: New York, New York! Well let’s start of by saying thank you to a little storm that made all of our VQS dreams come true: Tropical Storm Noel! This little ditty could have not been better placed for the two Jellyfish events that we had scheduled for the weekend. I didn’t mind the cold because the waves were firing and we had a two full days of VQS madness ahead. Once again New York comes through with epic waves and a town full of friendly locals with smiles from ear to ear. Music by Aloke.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Blowfish Surf Series - Oceanside, San Diego
item.description: Oceanside always seems to be a hub for an abundance of waves and surfers at any given time. The second stop of Volcom's Blowfish Surf Series at South Jetty, Oceanside brought 3-5 ft peaky surf along with over a 140 competitors flooding the beach at first light to sign up and get there share of some good waves, food, prizes and cash up for grabs. Here's how the finals unfolded, music by Valient Thorr.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Seacow Surf Series - The Poles, Jacksonville, FL
item.description: The Seacow Surf Series kicked off in very windy, shifty, blown out conditions at one of our favorite places in the world, the Mayport Poles. Despite the conditions being as tough as they can get we had a great turn out with over 100 competitors from all over the wonderful state of Florida. With $125,000.00 in prize money up for grabs at the 07/08 VQS champs the points race was on to qualify and heres how it all ended up.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Pufferfish Surf Series - Pinetree's, Kauai, HI
item.description: The first stop of the Hawaiian Pufferfish Surf Series went down at Pinetrees on the North Shore of Kauai. After being postponed on Saturday due to flat surf, we arrived on Sunday morning and were greeted with a new swell that would keep building throughout the day. Conditions were clean with light offshore winds and waist to head high rippable surf. Music by Kandi Coded.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: The first stop of the Hawaiian Pufferfish Surf Series went down at Pinetrees on the North Shore of Kauai. Conditions were clean with light offshore winds and waist to head high rippable surf. Music by Kandi Coded.

item.title: 2007 Damn Am at Volcom!
item.description: The 7th annual Damn Am at Volcom took place on October 26-28th in our parking lot. Check the footage of all kinda of randomness from the three-day skate skate event. The 2007 Damn Am winner was Scott DeCenzo, with Chris Mendes taking the best trick. Music by: ASG.

item.title: 2007 Wild in the Parks - Hyeres, France
item.description: The 2007 Wild in the Park France took place in Hyeres, France this October. Check out all the action that went down. Bryan Bunting won the under 15 division, while Bastien Salabanzi took home first in the 16 and over and best trick divisons. Music by: Mystik Motorcycles.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Goldfish Surf Series - The Rock, Morro Bay
item.description: The first event of the Goldfish Surf Series landed right in time for the yearly shark sightings on the Central Coast. This years White Shark was spotted in Cayucos several times just 5 miles North of Morro Rock, including the day before the event! However, with 4-6 reeling lefts off of Morro Rock the day of the event, everyone quickly forget about what was underneath them and focused on what was up for grabs in front of them such as, cold hard cash, heaps of prizes, and bragging rights! Music by: Kandi Coded
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: The first event of the Goldfish Surf Series landed right in time for the yearly shark sightings on the Central Coast. Music by: Kandi Coded

item.title: Volcom Stone's Bushfish Surf Series - Kill Devil Hills, NC
item.description: The first Cooterfish event of the season was again one to remember. Overhead conditions (On the Groms) and sunny weather brought out all kinds of life to First Street in Kill Devil Hills with everyone looking to gain points towards the 2008 VQS Champs. Here is a brief rundown on the day’s competition. Music by Inbred.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Greatwhite Surf Series - Pleasure Point, CA
item.description: Once again The Greatwhite Surf Series was greeted with amazing surf for the season opener at Pleasure Point. The day started off with strong rain and cold conditions, but plenty of waves to go around. However mid day the rain would subside and the swell seamed to pour on more with a solid 45-minute period off none stop sets coming in. The competitors took advance of the pumping surf, beach antics, prizes and cash on the line. Music by: ASG.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: Once again The Greatwhite Surf Series was greeted with amazing surf for the season opener at Pleasure Point. The competitors took advance of the pumping surf, beach antics, prizes and cash on the line. Music by: ASG.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Bushfish Surf Series - Corpus Cristi, TX - Sept. 29th 2007
item.description: Texas! That's right I said Texas! A surf contest in Texas? Yep, we go to Texas to run a surf event and we always have a good time. This year was no different, the Corpus hellions were up to there original antics and they did not disappoint. As usual we woke up to heavy rain in the early morning but it subsided and we were greeted with a ton of smiling kids ready to rip the fun waist high surf. Music by: ASG.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom

item.title: Volcom Stone's Seaslug Surf Series - El Porto, LA - Sept. 22nd 2007
item.description: After a summer full of great weather, it felt like winter was upon us in a flash with a random rainstorm that blasted the first event of the Seaslug Surf Series. From rain, wind, and amazing rainbows the surf stayed contestable throughout the day to let the brave troops that showed up take on the storm and compete for some valuable VQS points. Music by: ASG.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Year Long Disaster at the Volcom booth in San Diego at ASR
item.description:
After the promo toss and after the first round of brews were served up, Year Long Disaster plugged in and stepped onto the tiny stage we built into the Volcom booth for this past weekend's ASR tradeshow in San Diego and proceeded to totally rock the few hundred onlookers.

Year Long Disaster's slef-titled debut album is available now on 180 gram 2XLP vinyl and will be out on CD and available digitally on Oct. 9th (pre-order it now and get free Volcom Ent t-shirt).

item.title: Volcom Stone's Starfish Surf Series - 9th Street, HB
item.description: Stop number two of the Starfish Surf Series went down on August 18, 2007 at 9th St. Huntington Beach. We were blessed with fun consistent 2-4ft wind swell along with a huge turnout in the Groms division. As the summer comes closer and closer to an end you could tell the kids were frothing for some final summer excitement. And what better way to do it then by soaking up some rays, stuff your belly with food, surf your brains out and win some free stuff! Music by: Riverboat Gamblers.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom

item.title: Volcom's 2007 Blowfish Surf Series - Ocean Beach, San Diego
item.description: It’s been a few years since the Crustaceous Tour was made a stop at Ocean Beach and it was long over due. Now OB is any interesting place with strung out junkies from the 70's, crazy bums, hostile lifeguards, college partiers, hippies, you name it and OB's got it. However for some reason though, this place is popular among San Diego surfers, and it showed with the amount of kids that showed up for the day. Music by Birds of Avalon.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: 2007 Peanut Butter and Rail Jam Champs - Mammoth Mountain, CA
item.description: Volcom’s worldwide 06/07 Peanut Butter and Rail Jam Tour culminated in a $30,000 Championship event at Mammoth Mountain, CA Sat May 19, 2007. Fourteen regional events reaching to the far corners of the continent brought together the best amateur snowboarding talent out there. In addition to a huge $30,000 prize purse, and a live webcast at volcom.com, the stakes were raised further when the top 3 European Peanut Butter and Rail Jam champions flew over the pond to take on 207 of their North American counterparts!
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: 2007 VQS Championships at 54th Street in Newport Beach, CA
item.description: The 2007 VQS Totally Crustaceous Surfing Championships has come to a peaceful end and all the protests signs have been put away. It was a totally righteous three days filled with love, friendship, and a groovy atmosphere. If you didn’t tune into any of the live webcast we had going of the event, hopefully you can get a good feel at home of everything that went down over the three day championships. Music by Crazy Jeff.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone Presents: The Dawn of the Stone Age
item.description: An animated film based on a few of Volcom’s pro surfers and a few colorful characters, “The Dawn of the Stone Age” is a journey through space and time. The movie tells the tale of Caveman’s adventures interacting with the likes of Bruce Irons, Dean Morrison, Ozzie Wright, Gavin Beschen, Shawn Barron, Kaiborg, and Johnny Stone. Sit back, relax, get some popcorn, melt into your seat and watch The Dawn of the Stone Age unfold right before your eyes!
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Catfish Surf Series - Aviones, Puerto Rico
item.description: Aviones sits on a beautiful little stretch of beach directly in front of our good friend and team rider Willie Carrosco’s house. It’s also 15 min from San Juan, which has its fill of fun as well. The vibe of this event was super laid back and mellow, as the event came to a close on Sunday afternoon it seemed like the entire town was in front of Willitos house having some drinks and enjoying that last bit of light left in the day. Here is a recap of our weekend at the Catfish Surf Series. Music by Arkham.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Pearlfish Surf Series - Papara, Tahiti
item.description: The waves at the rootsy village of Papara were 3-4 feet with glassy lefts and rights gracing the event all day long. Also, worth mentioning that it was like 80 degrees before the sun even came up and over eighty kids were up bright and early for a very hot and humid day at the first ever Pearlfish event in Tahiti on March 11th, 2007. Music by Die Hunns.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.description: This past weekend we closed the books on the last regional west coast events of the Totally Crustaceous season before the 2007 VQS Champs in May. Kids from up and down the coast were scrambling to snatch up those last qualifying spots at the final Butterfish event. With the event being double rated, the kids were flaring up on the fun 2-4t surf to make it count. Music by Die Hunns.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Alpacafish Surf Series - San Bartolo, Peru
item.description: For the second year in a row Volcom VQS tour invades Peru! This year’s Alpacafish Surf Series went down in San Bartolo, a cool beach setup squeezed in-between two jetties with a left right split peak. The kids took full advantage of the fun 2-4ft surf that San Bartolo had to offer as spectators littered the jetties and beach watching the kids while sucking down on free Lamborghini ice creams. Music by: ASG.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Blowfish Surf Series - Black's Beach, San Diego
item.description: The Blowfish Surf Series wrapped up its final event last weekend at Blacks Beach in San Diego. Now Blacks is a interesting place, from weird nude beach lurkers, to hang gliders, to territorial lifeguards, and perfect 4-6 foot surf, you never know what your going to run into down there. Trust me at the Blowfish we ran into every single one of them which made for an eventful day. Music by Lagwagon.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: A skate mission to the Cayman Islands
item.description: Last January, Remy and Steve Stratton planned a trip with Rune Glifberg, Mark Appleyard, Collin Provost, Ivan Rivado, Alain Goikoetxea and Han Claessens to the skate the Black Pearl Skatepark in the Cayman Islands. The boys skated under the hot sun at the park and chilled on the beautiful Caribbean island and this is a little sneak peak of all the action. Music by Sounder and ASG.

item.description: The 6th stop on the 2006/07 North American Peanut Butter and Rail Jam tour went down at Mountain Creek, New Jersey on the chilly evening of Saturday, January 26th. This being our second night jam in as many weeks, we were looking forward to building on the momentum that had begun on the West Coast January 19 (Mountain High, CA) and putting an Eastern spin on things. Music by ASG.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Seaslug Surf Series - El Porto, Los Angeles
item.description: The Seaslug Surf Series attacks LA! Over 140 competitors showed up for the last Seaslug event of the 06/07 season. An incoming storm had been brewing for a few days and unleashed some fun 3-5 ft surf for the day of the event. Once again the kids showed up in full attack mode to grab those important VQS qualifying points towards the VQS Championship in May. It was a great day of surfing along some outrageous beach games for the kids to burn off some energy. Here are some highlight from the day. Music by ASG.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom Stone's Greatwhite Surf Series - Steamer Lane, Santa Cruz, CA
item.description: The final event of The Greatwhite Surf Series went down on February 3rd, 2007 at The Lane on the Westside of Santa Cruz. The surf in the morning was 4-6 feet and side offshore, as the day marched on the tide dropped and the ocean turned to oil like glass, the sun shined the surf just kept pumping, it was an epic day at the lane.

item.title: Volcom Stone's Starfish Surf Series - River Jetties, Huntington Beach, CA
item.description: The Starfish finale for 06/07 VQS tour went down this past weekend at River Jetties in Huntington Beach. It was time to see who would qualify for the top five spots from each divisions for an invite to the $100,000.00 VQS Championship in May 2007. The Artic south wind blew all day, but the surf kept its shape as the competitors braved the conditions and threw down for those qualifying spots. Music by Valient Thorr.

item.description: We had been scheduled to run the event on Saturday January 20th, but Mother Nature had an off day and decided to give us waves the following day. item.description: The third stop on the Butterfish Surf Series went off at Pipes in Ventura under sunny skies, freezing offshore winds and 4-6 ft peelers. At first light all we could see was feathering right handers coming down the point with groms creeping out of the dark to sign up for a day of slashing at Pipes. Here are some highlights from the day. Music by Guttermouth.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: The 3rd stop on the Butterfish Surf Series went off at Pipes in Ventura under sunny skies, freezing offshore winds and 4-6 ft peelers. Here are some highlights from the day.

item.title: Webisode 1 - The Escramble Bonus Footage Download Project
item.description: Webisode 1 staring Bjorn Leines, Seth Huot, Wille Yli- Louma, Mark Landvik, Erik Leines, Terje Haakonsen, Chris Demolski and Scott Blum. The montage of riding is from around the world at locations such as Tahoe, Alaska, Montana, Europe, and a few secret locations. The Webisode starts with a tribute to powder and freeride featuring the music of Turbonergo. From there its breaks in to a fierce action packed sequence with some serious bangers along with music from Nilhilst. Cinematography by Nathan Yant, Gary Pendygrasse, Jake Raynor and Trent Ludwig.

item.description: For the second weekend in a row, The Totally Crustaceous was bombed with a large North West swell. After giant closeout barrels at the Seaslug in Hermosa Pier last weekend, we head up North for the Goldfish Surf Series Stop #2 at Pismo Pier and ran into some more macking surf. Music by Riverboat Gamblers.

item.title: Seaslug Surf Series - Hermosa Beach, California
item.description: The Second stop of the Seaslug Surf Series took place at Hermosa Beach Pier on December 9, 2006. A huge north swell came in the night before the event and made for some very interesting conditions the next morning with over head closeout barrels slaming the beach. Throughout the day the swell grew bigger and bigger and the Groms were shaking in there boots as they battled it out at the pier. Check out how it all went down. Music by ASG.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)

item.title: Volcom's Seacow Surf Series - Sebastian Inlet, Florida
item.description: The Seacow Surf Series made it’s first stop of the year at Sebastian Inlet State Park in the wonderful state of Florida. For the last couple of years this event has been growing and this year was by far the biggest Seacow event ever! We set up the beach and got underway with 186 competitors fighting for invites to the $100,000.00 Dollar VQS Champs in May of 2007. Music by Single Frame.

item.title: Goldfish Surf Series - The Rock, Morro Bay, CA
item.description: The Central coast is always a gamble of what the weather conditions can be like. It might be sunny with off shore winds and 4-6ft surf or it can be windy and rainy with1-2 ft surf or 20 ft or strong onshore winds for weeks on end. However, for the Season opener of the Goldfish Surf Series, we lucked out and scored some rippable 3-4 ft peaks at Morro Rock under overcast sky’s with glassy conditions. Music by Raised Fist.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: Season opener of the Goldfish Surf Series, we lucked out and scored some rippable 3-4 ft peaks at Morro Rock under overcast sky’s with glassy conditions. Music by Raised Fist.

item.title: Starfish Surf Series - Goldenwest Street, Huntington Beach
item.description: The second stop of the Starfish Surf Series went down at Goldenwest Street in Huntington Beach, California. After two weeks of flat surf, we were finally blessed with a playful 3-4ft. south swell and everyone was just plain fired up to surf some head high waves. Once again the Starfish would be a packed event with hungry groms scrambling for waves, overall points and cool prizes. MUSIC BY: Guttermouth

item.title: Wild In the Parks Stop 4, Denver, CO
item.description: There is something for everyone in Colorado, which always makes our visits too short. First and foremost, there are over 90 skateparks in the state, which lands it in second behind only California. Aside from not having to look too hard to find a skatepark, Colorado is also full of lakes, mountains and a healthy assortment of urban attractions…of course the “Mile High” city’s main attraction this past weekend was definitely the Wild in the Parks! MUSIC BY: Valient Thorr
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom
item.itunes:subtitle: There is something for everyone in Colorado, and the “Mile High” city’s main attraction this past weekend was definitely the Wild in the Parks! MUSIC BY: Valient Thorr

item.title: Starfish Surf Series - 9th St. Huntington Beach
item.description: The Totally Crustaceous Tour kicked off the 2006/2007 Season with the Starfish Surf Series at 9th St. Huntington Beach. Over 200 Competitors showed up to get a chance to surf the season opener. Lucky for us, it stays light until 8:30 and we used every last minute of it fitting 190 contestants in the event, which ran over 12 hours. It was perfect day at the beach, with blistering hot temperatures and some fun 3-4ft waves with some occasional bigger sets. MUSIC BY: Arkham
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom

item.title: Wild In The Parks At 3rd Lair Skatepark
item.description: The 3rd stop on the 2006 North American Wild in the Parks Tour went down Sunday July 9th at the Minneapolis area’s 3rd Lair Skatepark. Never having been to Minnesota, I took the opportunity to educate myself on a few quick points of interest. Apparently, many well-known celebrities are byproducts of the state. A local magazine I glanced through spit tantalizing names like Bob Dylan and Betty Crocker, not to mention household hammers like Rocky & Bullwinkle. MUSIC BY: Riverboat Gamblers

item.title: Wild in the Parks Stop 2, Raleigh, North Carolina
item.description: The second stop of the 2006 North American Wild in the Parks series went down Saturday June 24 in Raleigh, North Carolina. Another source of NC pride would have to be Project 58 skatepark. Not only does the park have great street and bowl sections, but it is also air-conditioned! To make things even better, there is a skateshop called Vertical Urge, a little restaurant and a video arcade. Serious stuff. MUSIC BY: Valient Thorr

item.title: Trailer for the Riverboat Gamblers on IFC News Presents: SXSW Behind The Badge
item.description: For the 2006 SXSW Music Festival in Austin, TX this year the Riverboat Gamblers were selected represent the music panelist for IFC's special, SXSW Behind The Badge. To get a real insider's perspective, hangovers and all, IFC handed over mini DV cameras to a music panelist, interactive panelist, and film panelist to give viewers a fuller perspective of the scope of the events that take place over the 9 days the festival runs in Austin. SXSW Behind The Badge starts airing May 1st on IFC, but you can watch it now as a sneak peak or if don't get the IFC channel on IFC's website here

item.title: Volcom Ent SXSW Podcast, new tunes from Riverboat Gamblers, Single Frame, and Vaux
item.description:
As we sit here day dreaming about heading to Austin, TX for SXSW next week and all the Shiner and BBQ we are going consume, we put together this little podcast of new music from the Volcom Ent bands that are involved in this year's festival.

02 Riverboat Gamblers - Rent Is Due
03 Single Frame - Exact Copy (Creepykid Remix)
04 Single Frame - Clipper Ship
05 Vaux - Identity Theft
06 Vaux - Never Better

item.title: Creepy Fingers Trailer
item.description:
What Are Creepy Fingers? Find out this March as you witness the antics of Bruce Irons, Ozzie Wright, Dean Morrison, Gavin Beschen, Bol, Mike Morrissey, Nate Tyler, Jay Quinn, Alex Gray, Kilian Garland, Dusty Payne, Aron Gieger, Super Grom Andrew Doheny, and more.
Watch as Creepy Fingers winds its way through a cinematic foray of beauty, silliness, seriousness, and the general debris of human existance.
Sound Track provided by Volcom Entertainment

item.title: Vinyl Disaster Remixes by Nick Zinner, Creepy Kid, J-MPrint
item.description:
Previously only available as a promotional 12" for DJs and limited to 300 copies, The Vinyl Disaster Remixes feature remixes by Nick Zinner, Creepy Kid, and J-MPrint.

Track 1 - People Are Germs (Monster Mash remix by Nick Zinner)
Track 2 - Digital Witness (remix by Creepykid)
Track 3 - Floral Design (remix by J-Mprint)

The originals of Tracks 1 & 2 appear on Single Frame's 2005 album, Body/End/Basement" and the original of Track 3 appears on Single Frame's 2003 album, Wetheads Come Running.
item.author: volcoment@volcom.com (Volcom)
item.itunes:author: Volcom Entertainment
